skill.name: quetrex-development-workflow
skill.description: Bootstrap new Claude Code sessions with complete Quetrex project context and enable efficient issue-driven development for AI agent automation.
skill.summary: Quetrex project context loader for Claude Code sessions with AI agent workflow automation
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. Static findings are false positives triggered by bash command examples in markdown documentation. No actual command execution, credential access, or cryptographic operations present. All critical and high-severity findings dismissed after evaluation.

critical_findings.title: Windows SAM database access
critical_findings.description: Pattern 'SAM' detected in filenames and text. Static analyzer misidentified 'ARCHITECTURE-INTELLIGENCE-SYSTEM.md' as Windows SAM database. No actual SAM database access exists.
critical_findings.reasoning: The word 'SAM' appears in documentation filenames. No Windows SAM database code, credentials, or system access is present. Pattern matching false positive.

critical_findings.title: Dangerous combination: Code execution + Network + Credential access
critical_findings.description: Heuristic detected combination of command documentation, network references, and credential mentions.
critical_findings.reasoning: The skill is documentation-only. GitHub CLI commands and Claude Code CLI references are documented examples in markdown. No actual execution, credential exfiltration, or network calls occur. Network reference is source_url field.

high_findings.title: Weak cryptographic algorithm usage
high_findings.description: Pattern detected suggesting weak cryptographic algorithms.
high_findings.reasoning: Static analyzer misidentified 'Claude Sonnet 4.5' and version strings as weak crypto algorithms. The content is documentation text describing AI models, not cryptographic code.

medium_findings.title: Shell command examples in documentation
medium_findings.description: Bash command examples with backtick-style patterns found in SKILL.md documentation.
medium_findings.reasoning: Commands are in fenced code blocks (```bash ... ```), not executable backticks. This is standard documentation practice for developer skills. No command injection risk as there is no executable code.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded source URL
low_findings.description: Source URL field contains GitHub repository URL.
low_findings.reasoning: The URL is the legitimate source_url metadata field pointing to the GitHub repository. This is expected and required metadata, not a security risk.

content.value_statement: Managing Quetrex project context across Claude Code sessions is complex. This skill provides standardized workflows, command references, and AI agent automation patterns for efficient project development.
actual_capabilities: Provide project context setup commands for new Claude Code sessions
Document GitHub CLI commands for issue and PR management
Explain AI agent automation workflow with GitHub Actions
Define quality enforcement patterns with 6-layer defense system
Reference critical project files and their purposes
limitations: This skill provides documentation only, it does not execute commands automatically
Does not create issues or PRs directly, only documents how to do so
Does not manage credentials or authentication for GitHub or other services
Does not run tests, build projects, or modify code

use_cases.title: New session bootstrap
use_cases.description: At the start of a new Claude Code session, load project context and query pending AI-feature issues to understand what work is ready for automation.

use_cases.title: Issue creation for AI agents
use_cases.description: Create well-structured GitHub issues with ai-feature label to trigger automated agent workflows for feature implementation.

use_cases.title: Quality standard reference
use_cases.description: Look up TDD workflow patterns, test coverage requirements, and 6-layer defense system documentation to maintain code quality.

prompt_templates.title: Start new development session
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the quetrex-development-workflow skill. Query what AI-feature issues are pending and show me the current project status from .quetrex/status.yml.
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginning a new work session on the Quetrex project

prompt_templates.title: Create AI agent issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a GitHub issue for an AI agent to work on. I want to add cost tracking display to project cards. Include acceptance criteria, relevant files, and testing requirements.
prompt_templates.scenario: Preparing work for AI agent automation

prompt_templates.title: Review recent work
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the GitHub PRs from the AI agent bot merged recently. What features were completed?
prompt_templates.description: Show me the GitHub PRs from the AI agent bot merged recently. What features were completed?

prompt_templates.title: Debug failed automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Check recent GitHub Actions workflow runs for the AI agent. Show me any failed runs with their logs.
prompt_templates.description: Check recent GitHub Actions workflow runs for the AI agent. Show me any failed runs with their logs.

output_examples.input: Load quetrex-development-workflow and show me the pending AI-feature issues
output: You can query pending issues with:

output_examples.input: How do I create an issue for an AI agent to work on?
output: 1. Use the AI Feature Request template:
2. Add the ai-feature label to trigger GitHub Actions automation
3. The agent worker will pick up the issue and create a PR
- Relevant files and patterns to follow

best_practices: Run the context loader at the start of every new session to get accurate project state
Follow the TDD workflow pattern: write tests first, then implement code
Use the 6-layer defense system to maintain code quality standards
anti_patterns: Combining multiple unrelated tasks in a single AI agent issue
Skipping acceptance criteria when creating issues
Working without first loading the project context and checking pending issues

faq.question: Does this skill execute commands automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation, command references, and workflow guidance. Commands shown in documentation are examples that you run manually when needed.

faq.question: How do I trigger AI agent automation?
faq.answer: Create a GitHub issue using the ai-feature.md template and add the ai-feature label. GitHub Actions will trigger the agent worker automatically.

faq.question: What is the 6-layer defense system?
faq.answer: A quality enforcement system including PreToolUse hooks, PostToolUse hooks, Stop hooks, TypeScript strict mode, test coverage requirements, and CI/CD validation.

faq.question: Where is project context stored?
faq.answer: Project context is stored in CLAUDE.md (session context), .quetrex/memory/ (architectural patterns), and .quetrex/status.yml (current roadmap state).

faq.question: How do I check what work is ready for AI agents?
faq.answer: Query GitHub issues with: gh issue list --label ai-feature --state open. Only issues with this label will be processed by AI agents.

faq.question: What quality gates must pass before merging?
faq.answer: Tests must meet coverage thresholds (75% overall, 90% for services), all CI checks must pass, and TypeScript strict mode must validate without errors.
